Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public void getBoard()
        Method to accept the board from the user as a grid from stdin using Scanner class.

      • isValidBoard

        public boolean isValidBoard()
        Checks whether the board entered by the user is a valid puzzle or not. It does a simple check to see if any non-zero numbers have been repeated in the respective row, column, or a the small 3x3 grid of which it is a part of.
        Returns:
        Whether the entered board is valid or not

      • displayBoard

        public void displayBoard()
        Displays the puzzle (Solved + Unsolved) well formatted to stdout using the System.out.print() method. Adds some padding after every 3x3 small grid.

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Actually solving of the puzzle takes place here. The program goes through every position in the 2D array holding a zero value (empty position). Once it finds an empty position, it checks to see if it can place all numbers from 1 - 9 in that position (maintaining an arraylist of all possibilities). If the number of possibilities == 1, then that number is guarenteed to be the solution in that position. We continue this till the entire grid is full of non-zero numbers, used for checking whether the puzzle has been solved.

      • solve

        public void solve(int row,
                  int col)
        Recursive + Backtracking Solution to solve the Sudoku puzzle. Basically performing an exhaustive search for all possible combinations.
        Parameters:
        row - The row that we are currently interested in.
        col - The column that we are currently interested in.

      • next

        public void next(int row,
                 int col)
        Gets the next valid row + column coordinates and makes the method call to the solve method.
        Parameters:
        row - The row after which we are interested in.
        col - The column after which we are interested in.

      • isValidNumberInPos

        public boolean isValidNumberInPos(int row,
                                  int col,
                                  int num)
        Checks each row, column and 3x3 small grid to make sure that if we place the number (num) in that position (row, col), there will be no conflicts with other numbers.
        Parameters:
        row - The row that the current number is in.
        col - The column that the current number is in.
        num - The number we are looking to place in that position.
        Returns:
        Whether the number if placed in the position is valid or not.

      • isGridSolved

        public boolean isGridSolved()
        Method checks to see whether the puzzle has been solved. It does this by simply checking if there are only non-zero elements in the board. If there is a 0 in the board, we infer that all elements have not been filled in and hence, the puzzle is not solved.
        Returns:
        Whether the puzzle has been solved or not.
